form.label: support_summary_index
form.description: description: This dashboard view was built to help highlight searches which either read from or write to summary indexes. Install this view on the Monitoring Console in the splunk_monitoring_console app

search.query: |rest splunk_server_group=dmc_group_search_head splunk_server_group="$group$" /services/shcluster/status|head 1|fields captain.label|rename captain.label AS captain_label

| rest /servicesNS/-/-/saved/searches splunk_server=$captain_name$ timeout=0 | search is_scheduled=1 | search action.summary_index=1 | search disabled=0 | fillnull action.summary_index._name value=summary
| fields + action.summary_index._name | rename action.summary_index._name as "summary_index" | eval summary_index="\"".summary_index."\"" | stats values(summary_index) as summary_index | eval summary_index="index IN (".mvjoin(summary_index, ", ").")"

| rest splunk_server=$captain_name$ /services/configs/conf-macros timeout=0 | fields title definition | rex field=definition max_match=1000 "index\=\s*\"*\_*(?<index>\w+)\s*\"*" | search index=* | search $summary_index$ | fields + title | eval macro="\"*".title."*\"" | stats values(macro) as macro| eval macro="search IN (".mvjoin(macro, ", ").")"

index=_audit sourcetype=audittrail source=audittrail search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group="$group$" | fields _time, host,savedsearch_name,action,info,search_et,search_lt,search,search_id,user,total_run_time
| rest splunk_server_group=dmc_group_search_head splunk_server_group="$group$" /services/server/info | fields splunk_server,version,physicalMemoryMB, numberOfCores, numberOfVirtualCores

drilldown.link: search?q=| rest /servicesNS/-/-/saved/searches splunk_server=$captain_name$ | where is_scheduled=1 | search disabled=0 | stats count by title next_scheduled_time cron_schedule schedule_priority schedule_window dispatch.earliest_time dispatch.latest_time| fields title next_scheduled_time cron_schedule schedule_priority schedule_window dispatch.earliest_time dispatch.latest_time| rename title as savedsearch_name | join savedsearch_name [search index=_internal search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group=$group$ sourcetype=scheduler status=* dispatch_time=*]&earliest=$time.earliest$&latest=$time.latest$

panel.title: active summary indexes (summary indexes which have scheduled searches writing to them)

search.query: | rest /servicesNS/-/-/saved/searches splunk_server=$captain_name$ timeout=0 | search is_scheduled=1 |search action.summary_index=1 | search disabled=0 |fillnull action.summary_index._name value=summary | stats count by action.summary_index._name | fields action.summary_index._name | rename action.summary_index._name as "summary index name"

panel.title: summary index populating searches by summary index name (searches that write to a summary index)

search.query: | rest /servicesNS/-/-/saved/searches splunk_server=$captain_name$ timeout=0 | search is_scheduled=1 |search action.summary_index=1 | search disabled=0 |fillnull action.summary_index._name value=summary | stats values(title) as savedsearch_name by action.summary_index._name eai:acl.app | rename action.summary_index._name as "summary index name"

panel.title: searches that read from or write to summary index: $si$

search.query: | rest /servicesNS/-/-/saved/searches splunk_server=$captain_name$ timeout=0 | search is_scheduled=1 |search action.summary_index=1 | search disabled=0 |fillnull action.summary_index._name value=summary | stats count by action.summary_index._name | fields action.summary_index._name | rename action.summary_index._name as "summary_index"

table.title: read (from summary index) is only going to be as up to date as the last successful write (to summary index)

search.query:
| rest /servicesNS/-/-/saved/searches splunk_server=$captain_name$ timeout=0 | search is_scheduled=1 |search action.summary_index=1 | search disabled=0 |fillnull action.summary_index._name value=summary | fields title, cron_schedule action.summary_index._name,dispatch.earliest_time dispatch.latest_time allow_skew schedule_priority realtime_schedule eai:acl.app,eai:acl.owner,search | rename action.summary_index._name as "summary index" | eval tag="writes to summary index" | rename title as savedsearch_name | table savedsearch_name cron_schedule dispatch.earliest_time dispatch.latest_time allow_skew schedule_priority realtime_schedule eai:acl.app,eai:acl.owner tag "summary index" search
| append [| rest /servicesNS/-/-/saved/searches splunk_server=$captain_name$ timeout=0 | search is_scheduled=1 | search disabled=0 | fields title,cron_schedule,dispatch.earliest_time,dispatch.latest_time allow_skew schedule_priority realtime_schedule eai:acl.app,eai:acl.owner,search | rex field=search max_match=1000 "index\=\s*\"*\_*(?<index>\w+)\s*\"*"
| search $summary_index$ | rename index as "summary index" | eval tag="reads from summary index" | rename title as "savedsearch_name" | table savedsearch_name cron_schedule dispatch.earliest_time dispatch.latest_time allow_skew schedule_priority realtime_schedule eai:acl.app,eai:acl.owner tag "summary index" search ] | stats values("summary index") as "summary index" by savedsearch_name cron_schedule dispatch.earliest_time dispatch.latest_time allow_skew schedule_priority realtime_schedule eai:acl.app,eai:acl.owner tag search | search $si$ $tag$ | rename eai:acl.app as app eai:acl.owner as owner |rename "summary index" as "summary index contained in:"

html.p: Click savedsearch_name above to see dispatch latency.

search.query: `dmc_set_index_internal` search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group=$group$ sourcetype=scheduler status="completed" savedsearch_name=$ss$ | eval window_time = if(isnotnull(window_time), window_time, 0) | eval execution_latency = max(dispatch_time - (scheduled_time + window_time), 0) | stats max(execution_latency) as "latency seconds" by savedsearch_name scheduled_time dispatch_time | convert ctime(scheduled_time) as scheduled_time ctime(dispatch_time) as dispatch_time

`dmc_set_index_internal` search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group=$group$ sourcetype=scheduler status="completed" savedsearch_name=$ss$ | eval window_time = if(isnotnull(window_time), window_time, 0) | eval execution_latency = max(dispatch_time - (scheduled_time + window_time), 0) | stats max(execution_latency) as latency_seconds by savedsearch_name _time | timechart span=5m max(latency_seconds) by savedsearch_name

panel.title: macro definitions for indexes which are summary indexes

search.query: | rest splunk_server=$captain_name$ /services/configs/conf-macros | fields title definition | rex field=definition max_match=1000 "index\=\s*\"*\_*(?<index>\w+)\s*\"*" | search index=* | search $summary_index$ | table title definition index | rename title as "macro name"

panel.title: searches referencing a summary index through a macro

search.query: | rest /servicesNS/-/-/saved/searches splunk_server=$captain_name$ timeout=0 | search is_scheduled=1 | search disabled=0 | search $macro$ | fields title, cron_schedule,dispatch.earliest_time dispatch.latest_time allow_skew schedule_priority realtime_schedule eai:acl.app,eai:acl.owner,action.summary_index action.summary_index._name search |eval tag=case('action.summary_index'=="0","reads from summary index", 'action.summary_index'=="1","writes to summary index") | rename title as savedsearch_name | rename action.summary_index._name as "summary index" | table savedsearch_name cron_schedule dispatch.earliest_time dispatch.latest_time allow_skew schedule_priority realtime_schedule eai:acl.app,eai:acl.owner tag search "summary index" | rename eai:acl.app as app eai:acl.owner as owner

`dmc_set_index_internal` search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group=$group$ sourcetype=scheduler status="completed" savedsearch_name=$ss1$ | eval window_time = if(isnotnull(window_time), window_time, 0) | eval execution_latency = max(dispatch_time - (scheduled_time + window_time), 0) | stats max(execution_latency) as "latency seconds" by savedsearch_name scheduled_time dispatch_time | convert ctime(scheduled_time) as scheduled_time ctime(dispatch_time) as dispatch_time

`dmc_set_index_internal` search_group=dmc_group_search_head search_group=$group$ sourcetype=scheduler status="completed" savedsearch_name=$ss1$ | eval window_time = if(isnotnull(window_time), window_time, 0) | eval execution_latency = max(dispatch_time - (scheduled_time + window_time), 0) | stats max(execution_latency) as latency_seconds by savedsearch_name _time | timechart span=5m max(latency_seconds) by savedsearch_name
